title.title: Xinxu Gaoseng Zhuan
新續高僧傳
New Collection of Biographies of Eminent Monks

titleStmt.author: Yuqian喻謙(?-1932)

respStmt.resp: Markup Design, Schema, Outputs, and Archives
respStmt.name: Marcus Bingenheimer (MB)

titleStmt.funder: Chung-Hwa Institute of Buddhist Studies 中華佛學研究所

publicationStmt.publisher: Chung-Hwa Institute of Buddhist Studies 中華佛學研究所
publicationStmt.pubPlace: Jinshan, Taiwan 臺灣新北市金山區

availability.p: This electronic text is distributed by the editors under a Creative Commons Attribution Share-Alike Licence.

sourceDesc.p: Text base is the digital text contained in the CBETA edition of the Chinese Buddhist Canon (Version 2018).

profileDesc.creation: The Xinxu Gaoseng Zhuan is dated 1923 CE. According to the preface Yuqian compiled the biographies 1918-1923 in the Fayuan Temple 法源寺 in Beijing.

projectDesc.p: This digital version of the Xinxu Gaoseng Zhuan 新續高僧傳 is the first punctuated version of the text and adds nexus point-like markup to identify and compute SNA information. Similar markup exists for other Gaoseng Zhuan collections. For a description of the project and use cases see Marcus BINGENHEIMER, Jen-Jou HUNG, Simon WILES. 2011. "Social Network Visualization from TEI Data." Literary and Linguistic Computing 26(3): 271-278. And Marcus BINGENHEIMER. 2018. “Who was ‘Central’ for Chinese Buddhist History? - A Social Network Approach.” International Journal of Buddhist Thought and Culture. Vol.28-2: 45-67. All line break "\n" in "paragraph" will be removed before zip.
